org.modelio.vbasic.collections

Class TopologicalSorter<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.modelio.vbasic.collections.TopologicalSorter<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - type of the nodes

    public abstract class TopologicalSorter<T>
extends Object
    Topological sorter abstract class.

    Sorts a Directed Acyclic Graph, where vertices are accessible by getNodes() and edges with getAdjacent(Object).

    Usage:
    Implement getNodes() and getAdjacent(Object) then call sort().

    Author:
    cma, credits to Margusmartseppâ€Ž @ http://rosettacode.org

      • sort

        public List<T> sort()
             throws TopologicalSorter.CyclicDependencyException

        Topological sort solves a problem of - finding a linear ordering of the vertices of V such that for each edge (i, j) âˆˆ E, vertex i is to the left of vertex j. (Skiena 2008, p. 481)

        Method is derived from of Kahn's pseudo code and traverses over vertices as they are returned by input map. Leaf nodes can have null or empty values. This method assumes, that input is valid DAG, so if cyclic dependency is detected, error is thrown. tSortFix is a fix to remove self dependencies and add missing leaf nodes. 

         // For input with elements:
 { F1=[F2, F3, F4], F10=[F7, F4], F11=[F4], F2=[F3, F8, F4], F3=[F6],
 F4=null, F5=[F6, F4], F6=[F7, F8, F4], F7=[F4], F8=[F4], F9=[F4]}
 
 // Output based on getNodes() type:
 HashSet: [F4, F11, F8, F9, F7, F10, F6, F5, F3, F2, F1]
 TreeSet: [F4, F11, F7, F8, F9, F10, F6, F3, F5, F2, F1] (or ordered collection)
        Returns:
        Linear ordering of input nodes.
        Throws:
        TopologicalSorter.CyclicDependencyException - Thrown when cyclic dependency is detected, error message also contains elements in cycle.
